page.title: 11Transport
page.content: In 1985 the motor car is the main means of transport for making journeys over one mile. This means that in our area most people travel to work and do their main shopping by car. There are even people who use their cars for shorter journeys like to and from school. The alternative methods of transport are limited. There is the bus. This area has a reasonable bus service which is used mainly by the old and the young. The nature of the various communities within our area enables people to walk to the local shops or to school. The new developments in North Basingstoke are designed with walkways and subways to assist this. People also use bicycles, again this tends to be the young and the old. The sixteen-plus group also use the motor bike, a symbol of independence and power.
